intro: Tephrosia haussknechtii, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with compound leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated pods, and the plant is often found in dry, disturbed habitats. Tephrosia haussknechtii has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimalarial properties.
